sub_title: Artistic Director at Strijbos & Van Rijswijk
summary:
Strijbos & Van Rijswijk inspire the imagination through sound. Their installations and compositions transform everyday locations, objects, spaces and sometimes even thoughts.

The work of S&VR has not gone unnoticed. They have performed at many renowned festivals, concert halls and museums. Clients are found all over the world, from Los Angeles to New York City and from Montreal to the Geyonggi Province in South Korea. More information about these projects can be found below.

education.field_of_study: Composition Electronic Music, Composition in Context

awards.title: BEST OF Dutch Design Week 2016: Rocking Chairs
awards.description:
Rocking Chairs

interactive soundwork

Rocking Chairs are chosen as one of the best projects of the Dutch Design Week 2016 ! The jury is impressed by the talent of the artists Cristian Grässli and Strijbos & Van Rijswijk, and highlight the chairs because of the combination of beautiful visual design and interactive musictechnology.

awards.title: MUSIC PRIZE 2012 Prince Bernhard Culture Foundation
awards.description:
Strijbos & Van Rijswijk are awarded with the Music Prize 2012 of the Prince Bernhard Culture Foundation Brabant !

The Prince Bernhard Cultural Foundation has awarded Jeroen Strijbos and Rob van Rijswijk the Music Prize 2012 because – within their international musical practice - they link willfulness to accessibility and sense of technology to visual design. The jury is impressed by the creative versatility, professionalism and entrepreneurial spirit of the duo.

During festival November Music 2012 the prize was handed over by Martijn Sanders during their première of 'Cross Avenue', concert for string quartet & live electronics, in collaboration with New York Stringquartet Ethel.

awards.title: PRIX Ton Bruynèl 2010 honorary mention
awards.description:
"With the soundinstallation SoundSpots, Strijbos & Van Rijswijk created a beautifully designed installation, giving each spectator the possibility to experience a personal version of the narrative."

Roderik de Man, Anthony Fiumara  & Hans Timmermans (commission Prix Ton Bruynèl)

video: http://vimeo.com/9759352

The FOUNDATION TON BRUYNÈL was established in February 2000 in order to preserve his works and according to his wish, to help composers to develop their skills in the field of electronic music.
